original: Surgical pathology involves the examination of tissue samples to diagnose diseases or confirm the absence of disease. This process typically occurs when tissue is surgically removed from a patient. The evaluation is conducted through a combination of gross (macroscopic) and histologic (microscopic) examinations. Additionally, molecular properties of the tissue may be assessed using techniques such as immunohistochemistry and other labor
